title: Render markdown output with glamour for beautiful terminal display
description:
Enhance the existing markdown report output by rendering it beautifully in the terminal, similar to Charmbracelet's Glow CLI.

## Reference
- Glow CLI: https://github.com/charmbracelet/glow
- Glamour library (used by Glow): https://github.com/charmbracelet/glamour

## Current State
- `morphir validate --report markdown` outputs raw markdown text
- Users must pipe to external tools like `glow` or `bat` for nice rendering

## Desired State
- Automatically render markdown with glamour (the library Glow uses) when outputting to a terminal (TTY)
- Fall back to raw markdown when piped or redirected to a file
- Support `--no-color` flag to disable styling
- Achieve Glow-like beautiful rendering inline

## Implementation
```go
import "github.com/charmbracelet/glamour"

func renderMarkdown(content string) string {
    if \!isTerminal(os.Stdout) {
        return content // Raw markdown for pipes/files
    }
    
    renderer, _ := glamour.NewTermRenderer(
        glamour.WithAutoStyle(),
        glamour.WithWordWrap(terminalWidth()),
    )
    out, _ := renderer.Render(content)
    return out
}
```

## Features
- Auto-detect terminal vs pipe output
- Respect `NO_COLOR` environment variable
- Word wrap to terminal width
- Syntax highlighting for JSON code blocks (like Glow does)
- Styled tables, headers, and emphasis

## Example
```bash
# Beautiful Glow-like rendered output in terminal
morphir validate ./ir.json --report markdown

# Raw markdown when piped
morphir validate ./ir.json --report markdown > report.md
morphir validate ./ir.json --report markdown | less
```

## Libraries
- `github.com/charmbracelet/glamour` - Markdown rendering (same library Glow uses)
- `github.com/charmbracelet/lipgloss` - Styling
- `github.com/mattn/go-isatty` - TTY detection
close_reason: Completed glamour markdown rendering with TTY detection, NO_COLOR support, and comprehensive tests

title: Improve release process based on v0.4.0-alpha.2 retrospective
description:
## Context

During the v0.4.0-alpha.2 release, we encountered several issues that required 3 workflow attempts before success. This task tracks the recommended improvements from the post-release retrospective.

## Issues Encountered

1. **New modules without prior tags** - `pkg/bindings/golang` and `pkg/toolchain` were new but go.mod referenced v0.4.0-alpha.1
2. **Bash arithmetic bug** - `((var++))` returns 1 when incrementing from 0, causing early exit with `set -e`
3. **Missing setup-workspace in release workflow** - `go mod tidy` validates versions before applying replace directives

## Recommended Improvements

### 1. Update release-validate.sh

Add checks for:
- [ ] New modules without prior tags
- [ ] go.mod references to non-existent versions
- [ ] Simulate `go mod tidy` without go.work to catch issues early

```bash
# Add to release-validate.sh
rm -f go.work go.work.sum
bash ./scripts/remove-replace-directives.sh
go mod tidy -C cmd/morphir 2>&1 || echo "FAIL: go mod tidy would fail in release"
git checkout -- .  # Restore
```

### 2. Merge PR #544

The bash arithmetic fix in release-tags.sh (PR #544) should be merged.

### 3. Update release-manager skill

Add "Adding New Modules" section documenting:
- Create stub tags for new modules at prior version, OR
- Update go.mod references in same PR, OR
- Ensure setup-workspace handles the transition

### 4. Pre-release checklist additions

- [ ] Verify all new modules have tags or proper version references
- [ ] Run `goreleaser release --snapshot --clean` locally

## Related PRs

- #542 - Release prep
- #543 - Add setup-workspace to release workflow
- #544 - Fix release-tags.sh arithmetic (pending)
- #545 - Update internal module references
close_reason: Duplicate of morphir-10w

title: Sync GitHub Actions workflows with just recipes
description:
Our GitHub Actions CI workflows are not using our just recipes, which makes it harder to test CI locally. We should refactor the workflows to use just commands so that:

1. Developers can run `just ci-check` locally and get the same results as CI
2. There's a single source of truth for build/test/lint commands
3. Workflow maintenance is simplified - changes to build logic only need to happen in the Justfile

## Current State
- CI workflows define their own commands inline
- `Justfile` has `ci-check`, `lint`, `test`, `fmt`, etc. recipes
- The two are not always in sync

## Desired State
- CI workflows call `just` commands instead of inline scripts
- Local `just ci-check` produces equivalent results to CI
- All build logic lives in the Justfile

## Tasks
- [ ] Audit current CI workflow commands vs just recipes
- [ ] Update CI workflows to use just recipes
- [ ] Verify CI passes with the new approach
- [ ] Document the change in README
close_reason: Completed in PR #15 (e0de1e9). All GitHub Actions workflows now use just recipes (fmt-check, lint, test, build, verify). Removed duplicate ci-check scripts and ensured CI/local development use the same build logic.

title: Create reusable TUI framework for interactive morphir commands
description:
Build a shared TUI framework that provides consistent interactive experiences across morphir commands.

## Overview
Create a reusable TUI component in `cmd/morphir/internal/tui` that can be used by:
- `morphir` (main interactive mode)
- `morphir validate --tui`
- Future commands like `morphir explore`, `morphir inspect`, etc.

## Architecture
```
cmd/morphir/internal/tui/
├── app.go           # Main TUI application shell
├── layout.go        # Flexible layout manager (sidebar + main)
├── components/
│   ├── sidebar.go   # Collapsible sidebar with tree/list
│   ├── viewer.go    # Markdown/content viewer with paging
│   ├── statusbar.go # Bottom status/help bar
│   └── searchbar.go # Search/filter input
├── styles/
│   └── theme.go     # Consistent lipgloss styling
└── keymap/
    └── vim.go       # Vim-style keybindings
```

## Core Components

### AppShell
Main application container that manages:
- Layout (sidebar width, visibility)
- Focus management between panels
- Global keybindings (quit, help, toggle sidebar)
- Resize handling

### SidebarPanel
- Tree view for hierarchical content
- List view for flat content  
- Collapsible (toggle with `b` or `Ctrl+b`)
- Filterable

### ViewerPanel
- Glamour-rendered markdown
- Viewport with vim navigation (j/k, gg/G, Ctrl+d/u)
- Search within content (/)
- Line numbers (optional)

### StatusBar
- Current mode indicator
- Keybinding hints
- File/position info

## Usage Pattern
```go
// In validate command
app := tui.NewApp(
    tui.WithSidebar(fileList),
    tui.WithViewer(markdownContent),
    tui.WithTitle("Validation Report"),
)
return app.Run()

// In main morphir command
app := tui.NewApp(
    tui.WithSidebar(commandList),
    tui.WithViewer(welcomeContent),
    tui.WithTitle("Morphir"),
)
return app.Run()
```

## Keybindings (Vim-style)
| Key | Action |
|-----|--------|
| j/k | Scroll down/up |
| h/l | Switch panels |
| gg/G | Go to top/bottom |
| Ctrl+d/u | Page down/up |
| / | Search |
| n/N | Next/prev search result |
| b | Toggle sidebar |
| q | Quit |
| ? | Show help |

## Libraries
- `github.com/charmbracelet/bubbletea` - TUI framework
- `github.com/charmbracelet/bubbles` - Components
- `github.com/charmbracelet/glamour` - Markdown
- `github.com/charmbracelet/lipgloss` - Styling

## Blocked By
None - this is a foundational component

## Blocks
- morphir-tol (TUI validate command)
close_reason: Completed TUI framework implementation with all required components and demo application

title: IR JSON Serialization: Configurable emission strategies
description:
Add foundational JSON/JSONL serialization support to pkg/models/ir with configurable emission strategies.

## Background
Currently IR types use unexported fields, requiring ad-hoc serialization in CLI code. JSON serialization should be a first-class capability in the models package.

## Requirements

### Configurable Emission Strategies
Support different JSON emission modes via configurable MarshalJSON:

1. **Full Distribution** (traditional)
   - Emit entire Morphir IR as single JSON document
   - Compatible with existing morphir-elm tooling

2. **JSONL Split Emission** (streaming/batch)
   - Emit modules/types/values as separate JSON lines
   - Enables streaming processing of large IRs
   - Better for incremental/parallel processing

3. **Package Emission**
   - Emit with package context/metadata
   - Include package namespace, name, version

4. **Distribution Metadata**
   - Emit distribution info (version, etc.) as own JSON line
   - Support header/footer metadata lines in JSONL mode

### Implementation Approach
- Add MarshalJSON methods to IR types (ModuleDefinition, Type, Value, etc.)
- Create EmitOptions/EmitConfig for controlling emission strategy
- Support both pretty JSON and compact JSONL
- Maintain compatibility with Morphir IR JSON schema

### Types to Add JSON Support
- ModuleDefinition[TA, VA]
- ModuleDefinitionType[TA]
- ModuleDefinitionValue[TA, VA]
- TypeDefinition variants
- ValueDefinition
- Type variants (TypeReference, TypeRecord, etc.)
- Name, FQName, Path

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] json.Marshal(module) works without ad-hoc conversion
- [ ] Support full distribution emission
- [ ] Support JSONL split emission
- [ ] Support metadata lines in JSONL
- [ ] Round-trip: Unmarshal matches original
- [ ] Tests for all emission strategies

title: Design workspace member configuration schema
description:
Design the TOML schema for declaring workspace members. Include:
- [workspace.members] array with glob patterns (e.g., 'packages/*', 'libs/**')
- [project] section for member projects with name, version, exposedModules
- Consider exclude patterns for ignoring directories
- Document relationship between workspace root config and member configs
design:
# Workspace Members Configuration Schema

## Overview

This design follows patterns from Cargo and npm workspaces, adapted for Morphir's needs.

## 1. Workspace Root Configuration (morphir.toml)

```toml
[morphir]
version = "^3.0.0"

[workspace]
# Existing fields
root = ""
output_dir = ".morphir"

# NEW: Member discovery via glob patterns
members = [
    "packages/*",           # All direct subdirs of packages/
    "libs/**",              # Recursive: all subdirs under libs/
    "apps/*/frontend",      # Nested pattern
]

# NEW: Exclude specific paths from member discovery
exclude = [
    "packages/deprecated",
    "**/testdata",
]

# NEW: Default member to use when none specified (optional)
default_member = "packages/core"

# NEW: Shared configuration inherited by all members
[workspace.defaults]
source_directory = "src"
```

## 2. Project Section (for member projects)

Member projects use a `[project]` section in their morphir.toml:

```toml
# packages/core/morphir.toml

[project]
# Required: Project name - flexible format
# Can be any valid identifier: "my-project", "MyProject", "Morphir.Core"
name = "morphir-core"

# Optional: Package version (can inherit from workspace)
version = "1.0.0"

# Required: Directory containing source files (relative to project root)
source_directory = "src"

# Required: Modules exposed in the public API
exposed_modules = [
    "Types",
    "SDK",
    "IR",
]

# Optional: Module prefix for Elm-style qualified names
# If not set, derived from name or inferred from source structure
# Use this for morphir-elm compatibility or explicit module namespacing
module_prefix = "Morphir.Core"

# Optional: Dependencies on other workspace members
# dependencies = ["morphir-sdk"]
```

### Field Descriptions

| Field | Type | Required | Description |
|-------|------|----------|-------------|
| `name` | string | Yes | Project identifier (flexible: kebab-case, PascalCase, dot-separated, etc.) |
| `version` | string | No | Semantic version, can use `workspace = true` to inherit |
| `source_directory` | string | Yes | Source code location relative to project root |
| `exposed_modules` | []string | Yes | Public modules (without module_prefix) |
| `module_prefix` | string | No | Elm-style module prefix for qualified names (defaults to name if valid, otherwise derived) |

### Name vs Module Prefix

- **name**: Project identifier used for references, dependencies, and tooling. Flexible format.
- **module_prefix**: Elm-style dotted prefix for module qualification. Used when generating IR or for morphir-elm compatibility.

Examples:
```toml
# Modern style - explicit separation
name = "my-awesome-lib"
module_prefix = "MyAwesome.Lib"

# Elm-compatible style - name doubles as prefix
name = "Morphir.SDK"
# module_prefix defaults to "Morphir.SDK" (valid Elm module name)

# Simple project - auto-derived prefix
name = "utils"
# module_prefix defaults to "Utils" (PascalCase conversion)
```

## 3. morphir.json Compatibility (finos/morphir-elm)

The classic morphir.json format is automatically detected and mapped:

```json
{
    "name": "My.Package",
    "sourceDirectory": "src",
    "exposedModules": ["Foo", "Bar"]
}
```

### Mapping to [project] Section

| morphir.json | morphir.toml [project] |
|--------------|------------------------|
| `name` | `name` AND `module_prefix` (same value, since morphir.json names are always Elm-style) |
| `sourceDirectory` | `source_directory` |
| `exposedModules` | `exposed_modules` |

### Detection Priority

1. `morphir.toml` (preferred)
2. `.morphir/morphir.toml`  
3. `morphir.json` (legacy compatibility)

## 4. Workspace Types

### Virtual Workspace (no root project)

```toml
# Root morphir.toml - workspace only, no project
[workspace]
members = ["packages/*"]
```

### Root Package Workspace (workspace + project)

```toml
# Root morphir.toml - both workspace and project
[workspace]
members = ["libs/*"]

[project]
name = "my-app"
module_prefix = "MyApp"
source_directory = "src"
exposed_modules = ["Main"]
```

## 5. Directory Structure Examples

### Multi-package Workspace

```
my-workspace/
├── morphir.toml              # [workspace] with members
├── packages/
│   ├── core/
│   │   ├── morphir.toml      # [project] section
│   │   └── src/
│   ├── sdk/
│   │   ├── morphir.toml
│   │   └── src/
│   └── deprecated/           # Excluded
│       └── morphir.toml
└── libs/
    └── utils/
        ├── morphir.json      # Legacy format supported
        └── src/
```

### Hybrid with Root Project

```
my-app/
├── morphir.toml              # [workspace] + [project]
├── src/                      # Root project sources
└── libs/
    ├── internal/
    │   └── morphir.toml
    └── shared/
        └── morphir.json
```

## 6. Glob Pattern Specification

Patterns follow Go's `filepath.Match` plus `**` for recursive matching:

| Pattern | Matches |
|---------|---------|
| `*` | Any single path segment |
| `**` | Zero or more path segments (recursive) |
| `?` | Any single character |
| `[abc]` | Character class |

Examples:
- `packages/*` → `packages/foo`, `packages/bar` (not `packages/foo/bar`)
- `libs/**` → `libs/a`, `libs/a/b`, `libs/a/b/c`
- `apps/*/frontend` → `apps/web/frontend`, `apps/mobile/frontend`

## 7. Module Prefix Derivation

When `module_prefix` is not explicitly set:

1. If `name` is a valid Elm module name (PascalCase, dot-separated), use it directly
2. Otherwise, convert `name` to PascalCase:
   - `my-project` → `MyProject`
   - `foo_bar` → `FooBar`
   - `utils` → `Utils`

This ensures backward compatibility with morphir-elm while allowing modern naming conventions.

## 8. Config Resolution

When loading a workspace:

1. Find workspace root (walk up looking for morphir.toml with [workspace])
2. Resolve member globs against workspace root
3. Apply exclude patterns
4. For each matched directory:
   a. Look for morphir.toml with [project]
   b. Fall back to .morphir/morphir.toml
   c. Fall back to morphir.json
5. Derive module_prefix if not set
6. Merge workspace.defaults into each project
7. Return Workspace with resolved []Project

title: Improve validation performance for large Morphir IR JSON files
description:
The morphir validate command hangs indefinitely when processing large Morphir IR JSON files.

## Problem
Validation performance degrades dramatically with file size:
- 99 byte minimal IR (base-ir.json): validates instantly ✓
- 71KB test IR (expected-morphir-ir.json): hangs indefinitely (timeout after 10s)
- 15MB production IR (docs/server/morphir-ir.json): hangs indefinitely

The issue occurs at compiledSchema.Validate(irData) in pkg/tooling/validation/validation.go:110, suggesting O(n²) or worse algorithmic complexity in the JSON schema validation library.

## Impact
- Users cannot validate real-world Morphir IR files
- TUI feature (--tui flag) is untestable with actual production data
- Blocks adoption of new interactive validation features
- BDD tests only work with minimal fixtures

## Test Cases
Working (instant):
- morphir validate tests/bdd/testdata/morphir-elm/cli-test-ir/base-ir.json

Hanging:
- morphir validate morphir-elm/tests-integration/cli/test-data/rentals/expected-morphir-ir.json
- morphir validate docs/server/morphir-ir.json

## Potential Solutions
1. Profile validation to identify bottleneck
2. Implement streaming/incremental JSON validation
3. Add validation caching for repeated validations
4. Evaluate alternative JSON schema validation libraries
5. Add timeout with progress indicators
6. Implement partial validation mode (structure only)
7. Consider lazy validation strategies

## Related
Discovered while testing TUI enhancements (line numbers, goto-line, auto-select)

title: Add TUI validate command with interactive markdown viewer
description:
Create an interactive TUI version of the validate command using Charmbracelet libraries.

## Overview
Add a `--tui` or `-i` flag to the validate command that launches an interactive terminal UI for exploring validation results.

## UI Layout
```
┌─────────────────┬──────────────────────────────────────────┐
│ Files           │ # Morphir IR Validation Report           │
│ ────────────    │                                          │
│ ▼ Validated     │ ❌ **Overall Status: ERRORS FOUND**      │
│   ├ base.json ✓ │                                          │
│   ├ list.json ✗ │ ## File: list.json                       │
│   └ tree.json ✗ │                                          │
│                 │ ### Error Analysis                       │
│                 │ ...                                       │
│                 │                                          │
│                 │ [j/k: scroll] [q: quit] [/: search]      │
└─────────────────┴──────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

## Features
- **Sidebar**: Treeview file explorer showing validated IR files
  - Flat tree for single files, expandable for multiple
  - Status indicators (✓/✗) for each file
  - Click/enter to select and view file's report
- **Main Content**: Rendered markdown report
  - Styled using glamour (Charmbracelet's markdown renderer)
  - Pager-like scrolling behavior (less/bat style)
  - Vim keybindings (j/k, gg/G, Ctrl+d/u, /)
- **Search**: Filter/search within report content
- **Keyboard navigation**: Full vim-style navigation

## Libraries
- `github.com/charmbracelet/bubbletea` - TUI framework
- `github.com/charmbracelet/bubbles` - UI components (viewport, list)
- `github.com/charmbracelet/glamour` - Markdown rendering
- `github.com/charmbracelet/lipgloss` - Styling

## Usage
```bash
morphir validate ./path/to/ir --tui
morphir validate ./file1.json ./file2.json --tui
```

## Dependencies
- Depends on: morphir-go-y4a (reusable TUI component)
- Related: morphir-go-z3b (glow-style markdown output)

title: Add error code appendix to validation reports
description:
Improve validation report readability by adding an appendix with indexed rule descriptions.

## Current State
- Validation errors repeat similar explanations for each occurrence
- Users see the same suggestion text multiple times in long reports

## Desired State
- Assign error codes to each violation type (e.g., E001: Pattern mismatch, E002: oneOf failed)
- Reference error codes inline in the Detailed Errors section
- Add an Appendix section at the end with full descriptions for each error code used
- Only include error codes that appear in the report (no unused codes)

## Example Output
```markdown
### Detailed Errors

**Path:** `/distribution/3/modules/0/0/1/2`
**Issue:** [E001] '2052' does not match pattern...

---

## Appendix: Error Code Reference

### E001: Pattern Mismatch
Each name part must be either a lowercase word (starting with a letter) or a standalone number.
The Morphir IR schema requires identifiers to follow specific naming conventions.

### E002: Type Variant Mismatch
The value doesn't match any of the expected type variants...
```

## Benefits
- Reduces report verbosity
- Easier to scan for specific error types
- Consistent error documentation
